name: Path N GIST Esophagus
title: Pathologic N
notes:
**Note 1:** Histological examination of a regional lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 6 or more lymph nodes. If the lymph nodes are negative, but the number ordinarily examined is not met, classify as pN0. (1)

**Note 2:** Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in M (distant metastasis).

**Note 3:**  Regional lymph nodes for any part of the esophagus fall in the range from periesophageal/cervical to the celiac region.  Contralateral and bilateral cervical, supraclavicular, and mediastinal lymph nodes are included.

**Note 4:**  Celiac nodes are coded in N (regional lymph nodes) for lower thoracic (abdominal) esophagus; they are coded in M (distant metastasis) for cervical and intrathoracic (upper and middle) esophagus.  Cervical nodes, NOS are coded in N (regional lymph nodes) for cervical esophagus; they are coded in M (distant metastasis) for upper and lower thoracic (abdominal) esophagus.

**Note 5:**  Lymph node stations/groups are listed in parentheses when applicable.
